title: What is asset management? How can software handle it? - Quora

response.answer_text: Asset management, as the name goes, refers to managing of assets. Now, the question is, what is an asset? The asset consists of tangible and intangible assets. Tangible assets are those assets which have a physical form such as machine, building, computer, etc. Intangible assets are those that doesn’t have a physical form like patents, copyrights, goodwill, etc. An asset management software is a dedicated application that facilitates asset management by recording and tracking assets throughout their life cycle i.e. from their procurement to disposal. It provides senior management with complete details of the asset i.e. who is using the asset, condition of the asset, where is the asset located, how it is being utilized, etc. Asset management softwares are available in various types such as Digital Asset Management, IT Asset Management, Fixed Asset Management system, Software Assets Management, Enterprise Asset Management, etc. Here are few of the top asset management softwares:- ManageEngine AssetExplorer Spine Asset Manager SUMMIT Asset Management Fresh Service GxP Assets Management

Dear Kevin, There are multiple ways asset management can be automated by means of using software. 1. aspect is putting RFID tags/some kind of tags which can be recognized by a software.The other part is managing your software assets effectively by using software asset management solutions. This is equally important as more and more organizations are increasing use of multiple softwares for which they need license to use. And in order to be always compliant the organization needs to have a view of their intangible assets (Softwares).Asset management helps organization assess the life, usage deployment of assets across multiple locations so that they have a holistic view of all their assets.
